Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: எற்றிற் குரியர் கயவரொன்று உற்றக்கால்விற்றற்கு உரியர் விரைந்து.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: The base will hasten to sell themselves as soon as a calamity has befallen them. For what else are they fitted?.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A base person ('கயவர்') is shown at the very moment a calamity strikes them ('ஒன்று உற்றக்கால்'). A storm cloud of misfortune appears above them.
Layered_Composition.Midground: Instantly, without any hesitation or thought of resistance ('விரைந்து'), the base person puts a price tag on themselves and puts themselves up for sale ('விற்றற்கு உரியர்'). They are immediately ready to sell their loyalty, principles, and self-respect to the highest bidder to escape the trouble.
Layered_Composition.Background: The scene visually asks the rhetorical question, 'For what else are they fit?' ('எற்றிற்கு உரியர்'). Their immediate readiness to sell themselves is presented as their one defining, instinctual talent.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: The one thing the base are truly fit for is to quickly sell themselves out at the first sign of trouble.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The price tag appearing on the person is a stark, satirical metaphor for their lack of integrity. Their speed ('விரைந்து') in doing so shows that this is their primary, ingrained response to adversity.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A dramatic, stormy light illuminates the scene of calamity. The base person is lit with the cheap, transactional light of a slave auction. The palette is cynical and dark.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A stark, sudden shot that captures the calamity and the person's immediate, shameless reaction to it.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, ultra-realistic, with a focus on the pathetic and mercenary expression on the person's face.

Cultural_Anchors: They are fit for selling (விற்றற்கு உரியர்)
